properties.headline: Cricket - Thursday 7 to Monday 11 January - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park walking & transport route map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking & transport route map

properties.otherAdvice:
New Yearâ€™s Test: Australia v India at the SCG, from Thursday 7 to Monday 11 January. Day 5 Gates open 9am ahead of play starting at 10am. Play is due to finish around 6pm.

See the NSW Government website for the latest NSW Health advice and restrictions for the Cricket Test Match.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as cricket fans travel to and from the SCG. 

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium and will reopen when play has finished and crowds have cleared.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads around Moore Park from 6am until 7pm including sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK - THURSDAY 7 TO MONDAY 11 JANUARY

FROM 6AM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 17 January - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Macarthur at McDonald Jones Stadium from 4pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Tuesday 19 January - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers from 7:05pm to approx 9pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 5pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 16 January - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Stadium Australia from 5:05pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Olympic Park on Saturday afternoon as soccer fans travel to this Sydney Derby. Local roads in the precinct may close to accommodate the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive
